result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas T Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: From defendant dated 3/1/16 requesting to skip March payment and resume payments in April.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Thomas T Thompson in court with attorney Joseph James Dorlack.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed. Reading waived.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1, 2 and 3.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Court costs totaling $243.00 to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 09/01/2015; alternate 5 days jail - consecutive

Ct.  2:
- Court costs totaling $243.00 to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 09/01/2015 - consecutive ot Ct. 1; alternate 5 days jail - consecutive

 Ct. 3:
- Court costs totaling $243.00 to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 09/01/2015 - consecutive ot Ct. 1 & 2; alternate 5 days jail - consecutive

Defendant Thomas T Thompson in court with attorney Reisha Mitchell.  Sue Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Shawn Diedrich, from the City of Muskego Police Department, sworn in and testified. Cross examination by Atty. Mitchell. State rests. No testimony provided by the defense. State moves for bind over and provides closing statements. Closing statements presented by the defense and objects to the bind over.   Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
